str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the original form of tlao; a balance, i.e. a certain weight or 'talent'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Hard, violent, harsh, stern. From the base of skelos; dry, i.e. Hard or tough.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From dia and skorpizo; to dissipate, i.e. to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander.
